item.title: Appending additional payload to a PROPSHEETPAGE structure
item.description: A not-well-known feature of the common controls property sheet is that you can append your own custom data to the end of the PROPSHEETPAGE structure, and the system will carry it around for you. The traditional way of setting up a PROPSHEETPAGE is to use the lParam member to point to a structure containing additional data that is used by the property sheet: struct WidgetNameData { HWIDGET widget;

item.title: A .NET 5.0 Guide: From Idea To NuGet Package
item.description: As technology evolves and we progress as a community, I notice that older blog posts erode in their helpfulness. One of the topics I find myself constantly having to relearn, especially as an OSS author, is the ability to start a new project, build a continuous integration pipeline, and get my package to NuGet. It’s essential to understand how to design a workflow that works with your project, and in this post, we’ll take a step-by-step walkthrough of how to do just that.

item.title: 42 things I learned from building a production database
item.description: In 2017, I went to Facebook on a sabbatical from my faculty position at Yale. I created a team to build a storage system called Delos at the bottom of the Facebook stack (think of it as Facebook’s version of Chubby). We hit production with a 3-person team in less than a year; and subsequently scaled the team to 30+ engineers spanning multiple sub-teams. In the four years that I led the team (until Spring 2021), we did not experience a single severe outage (nothing higher than a SEV3). The Delos design is well-documented in two academic papers (in OSDI 2020 and SOSP 2021). Delos is currently replacing all uses of ZooKeeper at Facebook.
